1.description: A witcher on his way to collect payment for a contract. His two swords are stolen early in the story, setting off a chain of events.

5.description: Becomes embroiled in the politics of Kerack and the machinations of sorcerers while trying to recover his stolen swords.

3.description: A powerful sorceress with red hair who takes an interest in Geralt. Known for her fiery temper and significant magical abilities.

1.description: Geralt's bardic friend who gets into trouble early in the story, contributing to the theft of Geralt's swords.

5.description: The King of Kerack who hires Geralt for a dangerous mission. Has multiple sons vying for succession.

6.description: The elder prince of Kerack, involved in succession intrigue. Ambitious and ruthless.
The younger prince of Kerack, also involved in succession politics.

4.description: A wizard involved in the conspiracy surrounding Geralt's stolen swords. Has his own agenda.

9.description: A sorcerer at Rissberg who becomes involved in Geralt's investigation of magical experiments.

14.description: A young woman who claims to be Geralt's apprentice. Brave but inexperienced, she gets involved in Geralt's adventures.

23.description: A sorceress from the future who appears in the epilogue, studying the legend of Geralt of Rivia.

19.description: A shape-shifting fox spirit that Geralt encounters. Can take human form and has its own agenda.

9.description: A professor at Oxenfurt Academy who provides Geralt with information about magical phenomena.

10.description: A sorceress involved in the Rissberg experiments. Has knowledge of dangerous magical research.

2.description: One of the bandits who steals Geralt's swords at the beginning of the story.
The leader of the bandits who steal Geralt's swords. More intelligent than typical bandits.

5.description: The Queen of Kerack and wife to King Belohun. She is involved in the complex politics of succession and court intrigue.
A prominent courtier at the Kerack court who is involved in the political maneuvering around the royal succession.
The captain of the royal guard in Kerack, responsible for the king's security and maintaining order in the palace.
The royal chancellor of Kerack who handles administrative duties and advises the king on matters of state.

6.description: The court jester of Kerack who provides entertainment but also serves as a source of unfiltered truth and wisdom.
A noble lady at the Kerack court who is involved in the social and political intrigues surrounding the royal family.

9.description: A powerful sorcerer at Rissberg who conducts dangerous magical experiments and research into forbidden arts.
A Rissberg sorcerer specializing in mind control magic, representing the darker aspects of magical research.

10.description: A young apprentice at Rissberg who is learning the magical arts, representing the next generation of sorcerers.

2.description: The leader of a criminal organization that operates in the area where Geralt's swords were stolen. He has connections to the theft.
A halfling who runs various legitimate and illegitimate businesses, including connections to theft and smuggling operations.

3.description: A dealer in stolen goods who becomes involved in the trafficking of Geralt's stolen swords.

14.description: The captain of a merchant vessel who becomes involved in transporting Geralt and his companions during their adventures.
The first mate on Captain Wolverstone's ship, responsible for day-to-day operations and crew management.
An experienced sailor on Wolverstone's crew who knows the dangerous waters they navigate.
The ship's cook who provides meals for the crew and passengers, often serving as a source of ship's gossip and information.

18.description: The organizer of a local festival that Geralt attends, representing the civilian celebrations and community life.
A performer at the festival who entertains the crowds with music and stories, similar to Dandelion's profession.
A wealthy merchant and banker who attends the festival, representing the commercial interests in the community.

1.description: An elderly tavern keeper who serves Geralt and Dandelion at the beginning of their adventure, providing local information and gossip.

3.description: A skilled blacksmith who has knowledge about witcher swords and their unique properties, potentially helpful in Geralt's quest.

7.description: A priestess serving the goddess Melitele who provides healing and sanctuary to those in need, including Geralt.
The royal physician of Kerack who tends to the health of the royal family and important court members.

5.description: The stable master at the royal castle who cares for horses including Roach, Geralt's faithful mount.
A veteran guard sergeant who serves in the royal guard, experienced in combat and loyal to the crown.

6.description: The head of the royal intelligence network in Kerack, responsible for gathering information and protecting state secrets.

20.description: A mysterious figure who appears near the end of Geralt's adventure, possibly connected to larger forces at work in the world.

6.description: A diplomatic representative from Lyria who becomes involved in the complex political situation surrounding Kerack.

5.description: A noblewoman at the Kerack court who is involved in the social and political intrigues of the royal family.

6.description: A court musician who provides entertainment at royal functions and sometimes serves as an informal messenger.
A member of the royal intelligence network in Kerack who reports on threats to the kingdom.

9.description: A junior apprentice at Rissberg who assists in magical research and experiments under the supervision of senior sorcerers.

5.description: The head of Kerack's merchant guild who represents commercial interests in the kingdom's political affairs.

14.description: A traveling noblewoman who becomes a passenger on Captain Wolverstone's ship during Geralt's sea voyage.
The ship's bosun responsible for maintaining discipline among the crew and overseeing daily operations.

18.description: A wealthy merchant who participates in the local festival, selling goods and representing commercial interests.

19.description: Another fox spirit associated with the Aguara, representing the mystical forces that Geralt encounters.

3.description: The captain of guards at a prison where Geralt is briefly held, representing law enforcement during his quest.

1.description: The wife of tavern keeper Vesemir who helps run the inn and serves travelers including Geralt.

12.description: A traveling scholar and philosopher who discusses magical theory and ethics with those he encounters.

5.description: A beautiful noble lady at the Kerack court who becomes involved in the political intrigue surrounding the royal succession.
The royal chamberlain who manages the daily affairs of the Kerack court and serves as a key advisor to the king.

7.description: The royal physician who tends to the health of the royal family and becomes involved in treating those affected by the dangerous mission.

5.description: The royal treasurer who manages the kingdom's finances and often worries about the cost of royal ventures.
The royal armorer who maintains the weapons and armor of the royal guard and assists in military preparations.

14.description: The experienced first mate of the Ship Prophet who knows the dangerous waters and helps navigate treacherous passages.
The ship's navigator who uses stars and magical instruments to chart courses across dangerous seas.
A traveling noble who becomes a passenger on the Ship Prophet and witnesses Geralt's sea adventures.
A wealthy merchant who travels on the Ship Prophet for business purposes and gets caught up in the adventure.
A skilled rigger who maintains the ship's rigging and sails, essential for navigating dangerous waters.

9.description: A sorcerer at Rissberg who specializes in enchanting items and creating magical artifacts for the academy.
An alchemist at Rissberg who creates potions and conducts dangerous experiments with magical substances.
The captain of guards at Rissberg who protects the academy and its dangerous magical research.
The librarian at Rissberg who maintains the academy's vast collection of magical tomes and research.
The head cook at Rissberg who prepares meals for the sorcerers and students at the academy.

17.description: The master auctioneer who conducts the sale of rare and magical items, including items connected to Geralt's stolen swords.
An expert appraiser who evaluates rare items for auction, including magical weapons and artifacts.
The security chief who protects valuable items at the auction house and ensures safe transactions.
A wealthy bidder who competes for rare magical items at the auction, representing the elite collectors.
A noble collector who seeks rare items for his private collection and becomes involved in bidding wars.

18.description: The elder of the Borsodi brothers who manages their business operations and criminal connections.
The younger Borsodi brother who handles the more dangerous aspects of their criminal enterprises.
An accountant who manages the financial records of the Borsodi brothers' legitimate and illegitimate businesses.
The security chief who protects Borsodi operations and enforces their will through intimidation and violence.
The manager of Borsodi warehouses where stolen and smuggled goods are stored before distribution.
A skilled acrobat who performs amazing feats at the festival, entertaining crowds with death-defying stunts.
A talented juggler who amazes festival-goers with complex juggling routines using various objects.
A graceful dancer who performs traditional and exotic dances at the festival, captivating audiences.
A food merchant who sells delicious meals and treats to festival-goers, representing the commercial side of celebrations.
A merchant who sells small trinkets, jewelry, and souvenirs to festival visitors as mementos of the celebration.
A guard who maintains order during the festival, ensuring celebrations remain peaceful and safe for all participants.

19.description: An insurance investigator who looks into claims related to Geralt's stolen swords and becomes involved in the case.
A clerk who handles insurance paperwork and documentation related to valuable item theft and recovery.
An assessor who evaluates the value of stolen items for insurance purposes, including magical weapons.

14.description: A pirate captain who operates in the waters where Geralt travels, representing the lawless elements of the seas.
The first mate of the pirate crew who serves as the captain's right hand in raids and nautical operations.

17.description: The leader of a smuggling ring who deals in illegal goods and potentially stolen magical items.
A courier who carries messages and small contraband items for the smuggling network, operating in secret.

20.description: The master of an assassin's guild who becomes involved in the complex web surrounding Geralt's stolen swords.
A trainer who teaches assassination skills to guild members, representing the professional development of killers.
An informant who gathers intelligence for the assassin's guild, providing information on targets and opportunities.

3.description: Lytta Neyd's personal maid who serves the sorceress and witnesses her relationship with Geralt develop.
The steward who manages Lytta Neyd's household and property, ensuring everything runs smoothly for the sorceress.
A bodyguard who protects Lytta Neyd from physical threats, representing the mundane security even powerful sorceresses need.

8.description: An intoxicated spectator who loudly cheers during arena fights, representing the common folk's entertainment.
Manages the betting on arena fights, calculating odds and handling wagers from spectators.
An experienced arena fighter with many scars, representing the brutal nature of gladiatorial combat.

6.description: Runs an upscale brothel frequented by nobles and merchants, privy to court gossip and secrets.
A large, intimidating man who keeps order at the brothel and protects the women working there.

4.description: A wealthy merchant who trades in exotic spices and herbs, traveling between major cities.
Leads the armed guards protecting merchant caravans from bandits and monsters on dangerous trade routes.

7.description: The castle's master blacksmith who maintains weapons and armor for the royal guard and visiting nobility.

3.description: A street-smart individual who provides information to the city watch about criminal activities in exchange for coin.

2.description: Supervises the loading and unloading of ships at the port, dealing with merchants and sailors daily.
An elderly fisherman who spends his days mending nets and telling stories about the sea and its creatures.

1.description: A knowledgeable woman who gathers and prepares medicinal herbs, serving as the village healer.
A young boy who works at the inn, carrying messages and performing menial tasks for guests and staff.

7.description: A knight participating in royal tournaments, representing the chivalric ideals and martial prowess of nobility.

9.description: An elderly scholar who maintains ancient magical texts and forbidden knowledge at academic institutions.

3.description: A cheerful woman who sells fresh fruits in the market, known for her friendly demeanor and quality produce.

5.description: Carries official messages and proclamations between the royal court and distant locations throughout the kingdom.

1.description: A traveling musician who performs in taverns for coin, spreading news and entertainment through song.

10.description: A monk devoted to copying and preserving ancient texts, maintaining religious and historical knowledge.

6.description: A young nobleman at court, more interested in fashion and gossip than politics or responsibility.

1.description: The respected elder of a small village, who settles disputes and preserves local traditions and knowledge.

2.description: A bureaucratic official who inspects cargo and collects taxes on goods entering and leaving the port.

1.description: A village priest who tends to the spiritual needs of the local community and provides sanctuary to travelers.

2.description: An experienced sailor with many tales of sea adventures and encounters with marine monsters.

9.description: A traveling academic researcher studying magical phenomena and ancient history at various institutions.

5.description: Records official court proceedings and royal decrees, maintaining the written record of the kingdom's business.
Oversees all domestic staff at the royal castle, ensuring smooth operation of household services.

1.description: A former soldier who lost an eye in battle, now spending his days in taverns sharing war stories.

5.description: A young man who cares for the horses at the royal stable, with a natural gift for handling even difficult mounts.

3.description: Keeps the city streets clean, overhearing conversations and observing the daily life of the urban community.

4.description: Travels throughout the kingdom collecting taxes and tribute for the royal treasury, often accompanied by guards.

3.description: Announces news, proclamations, and public notices throughout the town with a booming voice.

4.description: A merchant who deals in rare and unusual items from distant lands, including curiosities and magical components.

6.description: Washes clothes and linens for the royal household, often privy to gossip from other castle servants.

7.description: A young man learning the craft of weapon-making under the tutelage of a master smith.

6.description: Imports and sells high-quality wines to noble houses and wealthy merchants, with extensive knowledge of vintages.

19.description: An ancient witch living deep in the forest, possessing knowledge of old magic and natural remedies.

9.description: A promising young student of magic, eager to learn but still mastering basic spells and theory.
Maintains and organizes vast collections of historical documents and magical texts in institutional archives.

4.description: Commands guards at kingdom borders, monitoring travelers and protecting against smuggling and invasion.

3.description: Carries confidential messages between various parties, paid for discretion and speed.
Claims to predict the future through palm reading and crystal gazing, popular among superstitious townsfolk.

4.description: A young person learning a trade craft under guild supervision, representing the next generation of skilled workers.

2.description: Maintains the harbor lighthouse, guiding ships safely to port and watching for storms and dangers at sea.

4.description: Specializes in selling rare ingredients and components needed for magical spells and alchemical preparations.

3.description: Patrols the city streets at night with a lantern, watching for crime and maintaining public order.

1.description: A person displaced by conflict, seeking shelter and safety while carrying news from war-torn regions.

2.description: Specializes in ship construction and repair, essential for maintaining seaworthy vessels.

1.description: A young person dedicated to serving at the temple, assisting with religious ceremonies and caring for visitors.
A craftsman who travels from town to town repairing household items and small metal goods for villagers.
Provides fresh bread and baked goods to the local community, serving as a gathering place for village gossip.

recaps.1: Geralt and Dandelion are traveling when they encounter trouble at an inn, leading to Geralt's swords being stolen.
recaps.2: The thieves who stole Geralt's swords are revealed, and Geralt begins tracking them down.
recaps.3: Geralt meets the sorceress Coral (Lytta Neyd) who offers to help him recover his swords.
recaps.4: The conspiracy behind the sword theft deepens as more sorcerers become involved.
recaps.5: Geralt is hired by King Belohun of Kerack for a dangerous mission while still searching for his swords.
recaps.6: Political intrigue in Kerack intensifies as the king's sons vie for succession.
recaps.7: Geralt navigates the dangerous politics of the royal court while pursuing his own goals.
recaps.8: The mission for King Belohun leads to unexpected complications and revelations.
recaps.9: Geralt investigates magical experiments at Rissberg, encountering dangerous sorcerers.
recaps.10: The dark nature of the Rissberg experiments is revealed, involving forbidden magic.
recaps.11: Geralt confronts those responsible for the magical experiments and their connection to his stolen swords.
recaps.12: A battle with rogue sorcerers tests Geralt's skills without his proper weapons.
recaps.13: The aftermath of the Rissberg incident leads to new complications.
recaps.14: Mozaïk appears, claiming to be Geralt's apprentice, adding complexity to his journey.
recaps.15: Geralt returns to Kerack to resolve unfinished business with the royal family.
recaps.16: Coral and Geralt's relationship deepens as they face danger together.
recaps.17: Dandelion returns to the story, bringing both help and trouble.
recaps.18: The group faces a new threat that requires all their combined skills.
recaps.19: Geralt encounters the Aguara, a shape-shifting fox spirit with its own agenda.
recaps.20: The confrontation with the Aguara reveals deeper magical mysteries.
recaps.21: The various plot threads begin to converge toward a resolution.
recaps.22: Geralt finally recovers his swords and settles all accounts.
recaps.23: An epilogue set in the future shows Nimue studying the legend of Geralt, placing his adventures in historical context.
